name: Action
effect: Actions are a type of _Maneuver_ that allow a character to take a _Turn_. Actions may be used whenever it is your party's time to act in combat. A character may only use a given Action once per _Round_ unless otherwise specified, and may take only a single Action in a given _Phase_.

name: Advantage
effect: When you make an Attack with Advantage, roll 3d6 and use the two highest for your result.

name: Angled
effect: As normal _Push_/_Pull_ but, rather than moving the creature directly away/towards you, move them away/towards and to the right or left (your choice) of you.

name: AP
effect: AP, or Action Points, are spent to use powerful _Actions_, _Stunts_, and other abilities. Player characters have 2 AP that they may use each _Round_. Unspent AP is lost at the end of the _Round_.

name: Armor
effect: Whatever clothing, protective plating, or other garments a character is wearing is referred to as their Armor. A character's Armor determines their _Movement_, their _Guard_, and may have other passive effects.

name: Artillery
effect: Artillery Disciplines specialize in long-range and prefer to keep their distance from foes. Artillery Disciplines are typically capable of high damage at long ranges but can struggle with Cover and other obstructions.

name: Attack
effect: An Attack is a type of _Manuever_ that allows a creature to target enemies. Attacks are never used on their own; other _Maneuvers_ and _Techniques_ will tell you when to use an Attack. Attacks are split into Major and Minor Attacks; Major Attacks are highly effective and deal high Damage, while Minor Attacks tend to be more focused on status effects and deal much less damage.

name: Attack Roll
effect: When a creature makes an Attack Roll they roll 2d6 and consult the Attack's _Profile_ to determine the effect.

name: Bonus
effect: When a creature has a Bonus they add that value to _Attack Rolls_.

name: Bonus Damage
effect: When an Attack gains Bonus Damage, distribute the Bonus Damage between targets however you wish. For a Single-Target Attack this is effectively a flat damage increase, but for an Area Attack any Bonus Damage must be split between all eligible Targets.

name: Charging
effect: While _Charging_ you may not willingly _Move_, use _Techniques_, or use _Actions_.

name: Charged Effect
effect: Many _Versatile_/_Heavy_ _Attacks_ have a Charged Effect . In exchange for delaying the resolution of the effect these _Attacks_ may gain additional power or effects. See _Strong Strike_ for a common example of how this process works. If an _Attack_ has multiple Charged Effects you must choose one.

name: Climbing
effect: When moving to a higher elevation that forces a character to climb, the total Movement expended is equal to twice the Elevation change. For example, it would cost a creature 2 spaces of Movement to Climb up a 1 Height Obstacle. While _Climbing_ a creature has _Disadvantage_ on all Attacks and Attacks against them have _Advantage_.

name: Collision
effect:
Whenever a target suffering _Forced Movement_ is moved into an Obstacle or creature, resolve it as follows:
* **Obstacle Colliding with Obstacle**: Deal Damage to both _Obstacles_ equal to the half the _Forced Movement_ remaining. If the Collided Obstacle is _Destroyed_ and the Colliding _Obstacle_ was not _Destroyed_, reduce the _Forced Movement_ by the Collided Obstacle's _Durability_ and continue the _Forced Movement_.
* **Obstacle Colliding with Creature**: Inflict _Push_ X on the creature, where X is the _Forced Movement_ remaining on the _Obstacle_. After resolving this _Push_, the creature gains _Vulnerable_ equal to half the spaces they moved. Continue moving the _Obstacle_ so it ends adjacent to the creature.
* **Creature Colliding with Creature**:  The Collider gains _Vulnerable_ equal to half the _Forced Movement_ remaining. Inflict _Push_ X on the Collided creature, where X is half the remaining _Forced Movement_ minus their _Size_, rounded down. The Collided creature gains _Vulnerable_ equal to half the total spaces they Move. After, inflict _Push_ equal to the total space the Collided creature moved on the _Colliding_ creature in the same direction.
* **Creature Colliding with Obstacle**: Deal Damage to the _Obstacle_ equal to the half the _Forced Movement_ remaining and inflict _Vulnerable_ on the creature equal to the same amount. If the Collided Obstacle is _Destroyed_ and the Colliding _Obstacle_ was not _Destroyed_, reduce the _Forced Movement_ by the Collided Obstacle's _Durability_ and continue the _Forced Movement_. If _Forced Movement_ remains and the _Obstacle_ was _Destroyed_, reduce the _Forced Movement_ by the Obstacle's _Durability_ and continue the _Forced Movement_.

If a secondary Collision occurs during a Collision **and** both parties are adjacent, resolve the secondary Collision effect on both.

name: Cold
Controller
effect: Controller Disciplines specialize in applying status afflictions to foes and moving them about the battlefield, limiting their effectiveness and making foes easier targets for allies.

name: Cost
effect: An up-front cost of an ability that must be paid at _Respite_ if it's a _Technique_, or when used for all other abilities.

name: Cover
effect:
Creatures may, depending on positioning, have a varying degree of cover. To determine Cover, characters should draw a line from the center of the Attack's origin space (typically the attacker's space) to the center of the target's space, referred to as the Attack Line:
* <ins>Light Cover</ins>: If the Attack Line passes through an Obstacle with a _Total Height_ equal to or greater than yours and the Target's and comes out an adjacent side, the Target has Light Cover. Attacks against a creature with Light Cover take a -1 _Penalty_.
* <ins>Heavy Cover</ins>:  If the Attack Line passes through an Obstacle with a _Total Height_ equal to or greater than yours and the Target's and comes out of non-adjacent sides of said Obstacle, the Target has Heavy Cover. Attacks against a creature with Heavy Cover take a -2 _Penalty_.
* <ins>Full Cover</ins>: If a creature is adjacent to an Obstacle with a _Total Height_ less than or equal to their own and the Attack Line passes through said Obstacle and comes out of non-adjacent sides of it, the Target has Full Cover. Attacks against a creature with Full Cover take a -2 _Penalty_ and gain _Glancing_.

name: Crit
effect: A particularly effective Attack, represented by a purple cell in the Attack's 'Roll' column in its _Profile_.

name: Crush
effect:
Damage caused by blunt force trauma, such as from a hammer or a flung stone.
 
When removing _Vulnerable_, you may inflict an equivalent amount of _Dazed_ instead of increasing Damage if you deal Crush Damage.
 
If a character is _Downed_ by Crush Damage, inflict the following _Wounds_ based on the roll:
 1-2: _Exposed_ 1
 3-4: _Exposed_ 2
5-6: _Exposed_ 2, _Reeling_ 1

name: Courier
effect: Courier Disciplines tend to have high movement among their abilities, as well as movement options that make it far easier to navigate terrain and enemy positions.

name: Downed
effect:
A creature becomes Downed when their Health reaches 0. For most NPCs, this means they are immediately _Defeated_. Player characters and more powerful NPCs instead roll for _Wounds_, which is done by rolling a number of d6s based on the number of times they have been _Downed_ prior to this.
* **First Down:** Roll 2d6 and use the lowest.
* **Future Downs:** Roll Xd6 and take the highest result, where X is the number of times prior to this they have been _Downed_.

A creature clears the number of times they have been Downed when they rest in a _Haven_.

name: Defender
effect: Defender Disciplines specialize in drawing fire from enemies and keeping them nearby, controlling enemies by limiting their targeting options

name: Disadvantage
effect: When you make an Attack with Disadvantage, roll 3d6 and use the two lowest for your result.

name: Draw
effect: Drawing is the main way that Waterbonded interact with _Sources_. All Draw effects will be listed as Draw X, where X is a numeric value. In these cases, reduce the combined value of any number of _Sources_ within the listed Draw range by X, destroying any _Sources_ that have their value reduced to 0. Waterbound may Draw from _Watersource_ _Sources_.

name: Durability
effect: How sturdy inanimate objects are. If an _Obstacle_ or _Equipment takes Damage in a single hit equal to or greater than their Durability plus their current _Guard_ (if any) they are Sundered.

name: Earthbonded
effect: A character that is bonded to an Earth Spirit.

name: Effect
effect: The primary result of using an ability. Typically, this is where the bulk of what a _Technique_ or other ability does.

name: Elevation
effect: The current Height of the _Terrain_ or _Obstacle_ that a character is standing on.

name: Elite
effect: Elite enemies are extremely powerful and can handle several characters at the same time. Elite enemies may never have more than 10 of a given _Token_, may use a Martial and Spirit Stance, and increase their maximum _Stamina_ by 2.

name: Fire
effect:
A damage type caused by searing heat and scorching flames.
 
When removing _Vulnerable_, you may inflict an equivalent amount of _Alight_ instead of increasing Damage if you deal Fire Damage.
 
If a character is _Downed_ by Fire Damage, inflict the following _Wounds_ based on the roll:
 1-2: _Burned_ 1
 3-4: _Burned_ 2
5-6: _Burned_ 3

name: Forced Movement
effect: Any effect that moves a creature unwillingly, such _Push_, _Pull_, _Throw_, and _Slide_ effects. This Movement does not trigger _Punish_ _Reactions_ but does trigger _Collision_ effects. When Negating _Forced Movement_, if any _Terrain_ effect would impact the cost of Negating it only applies to that space, and the _Forced Movement_ may be Negated at any point. For example, if a creature in an _Frozen_ space suffered _Push_ 3, the doubled cost would only apply to the _Push_ in the first space. They would, in effect, suffer _Push_ 1 with the conditions of the _Frozen_ space, leave that space, and may then Negate the remaining _Push_ 2 at the normal price.

name: Maneuver
effect: Many _Disciplines_ provide access to Maneuvers, which are special abilities that can be used on or off a character's turn for a variety of effects, depending on the type of Maneuver it is.

name: Penalty
effect: When a creature has a Penalty they subtract that value from the _Attack Roll_.

name: Equipment
effect: Any item that a character might carry into battle, such as a weapon, potion, or shield.

name: Equipped
effect: Any Equipment that a character has on their person.

name: Falling
effect: If a creature moves from one Elevation to a lower _Elevation_ take Crush Damage equal to twice the Elevation Change. If a creature takes at least 6 Damage in this way they also fall _Prone_. A creature may reduce this Damage by 2 for every _Stamina_ spent.

name: Free Turn
effect: When a creature gains a Free Turn they may immediately take a Turn, interrupting the current _Turn_ and ignoring the normal Initiative process. What they may do on this Turn is outlined in the ability, but any other ability that may normally be used on a _Turn_ (such as _Stunts_) may also be used.

name: Gambit
effect: Gambits are _Manuevers_ that allow characters to enhance an Attack. A character may use any number of Gambits on a single _Attack_, but only one with the _Feint_ tag and one with the _Flourish_ tag.

name: Gift
effect: When you Gift a _Token_ you lose up to the listed amount of that _Token_, then grant an ally the amount you lost.

name: Graze
effect: An attack that barely hits, represented by a yellow cell in the Attack's 'Roll' column in its _Profile_.

name: Hazard
effect: Hazards reflect an area that is going to be attacked in the near future or can be triggered as a trap. All Hazards are always cleared at the end of a _Round_.

name: Hit
effect: A solid connection with an Attack, represented by a green cell in the Attack's 'Roll' column in its _Profile_.

name: Improvise
effect: If a character finds they no longer wish to use a _Technique_ selected in the _Plotting_ Phase, they may choose to Improvise a _Technique_ by paying 2 _Momentum_ to replace it with a different _Technique_ on their Turn. This new _Technique_ must be playable in the given _Phase_. Some _Techniques_ are easier to Improvise, as denoted by the _Fluid_ keyword.

name: Imbue
effect: A way to enhance a _Technique_, typically by paying _Tokens_ or increasing the _AP_ cost of the _Technique_ that must be paid when the _Technique_ is selected.

name: Interact
effect: A special way to make use of an _Obstacle_ that is defined in its stats, typically used with the _Use Environment_ _Maneuver_.

name: Launching
effect: Launching can be applied to any kind of _Forced Movement_. The _Forced Movement_ is considered _Leaping_ for all effects and, at the end of the _Movement_, the creature _Falls_ X+1 spaces, where X is half the Launching distance, plus any applicable _Elevation_ change. If an effect gains Launching, all _Forced Movement_ of the same type gains Launching.

name: Lightning
Jump
effect: When a character Jumps, they may count _Movement_ up to their Jump Value (defined on their Armor) as [_Leaping_] _Movement_. This _Movement_ must be taken in a straight line, and this _Movement_ may not be broken up in any way.

name: Jump Value
effect: A value defined on a character's _Armor_ specifying how far they may move in a single _Jump_.

name: Minion
effect: Minion is the weakest class of NPC, and tend to be less capable. Minions have no _Stamina_, do not gain _Momentum_, and do not benefit from _Stances_. Minions only ever have 1 _AP_, but they may exchange it for 2 _Momentum_ at any time.

name: Maneuver
effect: An ability that character can either use to accomplish more on their _Turn_ or interact with the battle when it is not their _Turn_.

name: Total Height
effect: The _Elevation_ of an _Obstacle_ or Creature plus its Height. Most creatures have a Height of 1.

name: Major Source
effect:
A significant representation of an element that allows powerful effects.
* **Earth:** Any _Obstacle_ of at least Size 1 that is predominately made of earth, stone, or similar material.
* **Flame:** Any _Blazing_ space or _Alight_ creature.
* **Water:** _Watersource_ Terrain or _Obstacles_ with a value greater than 1.
* **Wind:** Any _Windy_ or _Electric_ Terrain.

name: Minor Source
effect:
A minor representation of an element. _Major Sources_ may always be treated as a Minor Source.
* **Earth:** Any _Terrain_ that is predominately made of earth, stone, or similar material. Additionally, terrain that is immediately above earth (such as the wooden floor of a house) may count for this.
* **Flame:** Any space that is not a Water Source.
* **Water:** _Watersource_ Terrain and _Obstacles_ with a value of 1, or a creature with _Soaked_.
* **Wind:** Any space that is not a Major Earth Source.

name: Source
effect: A locus of elemental energy such as stone, water, or flame. Sources are divided into _Major Sources_ and _Minor Sources_, and have a different representation for every element.

name: Miss
effect: A failed attack, represented by a red cell in the Attack's 'Roll' column in its _Profile_.

name: Move
effect: The distance or number of spaces a character can move. This will typically be either _Step_, _Reposition_, or _Dash_. These values are defined by your _Armor_. Some _Techniques_ or _Maneuvers_ may simply state a number; in those cases, you move that many spaces.

name: Negate
effect: Some Attacks or _Techniques_ give creatures the chance to Negate by spending _Stamina_. This is either outlined in the Effect of a _Technique_, or listed in parentheses next to a Status in an Attack's _Profile_.

name: Obscured
effect:
A state when a creature is difficult to see. A creature may be Lightly or Heavily Obscured. To determine Obscured status, draw a line from the center of the Attacker's space to the center of the target's space.
* <ins>Lightly Obscured</ins>: If this line clips an Obstacle of a _Total Height_ greater than yours and the target's or some _Terrain_ effects, they are Lightly Obscured. This has no impact on its  own, but works in conjunction with some effects such as _Stealthy_.
* <ins>Heavily Obscured</ins>:  If this line fully passes through an Obstacle of a _Total Height_ greater than yours and the target's, they are Heavily Obscured. A creature that is Heavily Obscured may not be targeted.
* <ins>Secondary Senses</ins>: Secondary Senses allow characters to perceive enemies in ways other than sight. When using a _Secondary Sense_, ignore the normal rules for determining Obscured and follow the rules of the _Secondary Sense_.

name: Open Hand
effect: An Open Hand is any Hand a character has that does not have any other Weapons or Equipment _Wielded_.

name: Opening
effect: When a creature creates an Opening they are doing something that compromises their defenses. Many _Punish_ _Reactions_ such as _Opportunity Attack_ allow a creature to make an _Attack_ when an Opening is created. Starting a _Move_ always creates an Opening.

name: Occupied
effect: While something is Occupied it may not be used for anything other than the listed effects. It still counts as _Wielded_ for the purpose of _Stances_ and the like, but may not be used for _Maneuvers_ or _Techniques_.

name: On Miss
effect: When an Attack misses, either due to a poor roll, a _Penalty_, or some other effect, resolve the _On Miss_ effect. If the Attack has multiple targets, only gain the On Miss effect if it misses all targets, ignoring _Obstacles_ unless the Attack is only targeting _Obstacles_.

name: Recover
effect: When a creature Recovers they may expend _Stamina_ to remove various status conditions, as outlined by the status effect or affliction.

name: Phase
effect: A Phase is a part of a _Round_ that exists to designate the speed at which different _Techniques_ happen. Phases 1-6 resolve in order, with _Techniques_ resolving with the Phase corresponding to their _Speed_.

name: Plotting
effect: The beginning of a _Round_ immediately after _Refresh_ where all creatures involved in combat select their _Techniques_ for the _Round_.

name: Puppet
effect: A Puppet is a piece of _Equipment_ that treated as if it was _Wielded_, but is controlled by spiritual magic and requires no _Hands_. While a Puppet, the creature may use it to make Attacks and may use its _Parry_ effect if it is adjacent to the beneficiary. The Puppet does not count as a creature, but any effects that trigger based off _Reach_ (such as _Opportunity Attack_) may be triggered from the Puppet's' position. Additionally, on each of their _Turns_, a creature may move the Puppet up to 5 spaces if _Light_ or an _Accessory_, 4 if _Versatile_, or 3 if _Heavy_ or _Armor_. If the Equipment is _Thrown_, move it to the final location and continue the _Puppet_. Finally, replace [_Martial_] with [_Spirit_] for any abilities using this _Equipment_, where the _Spirit_ type is the same as the ability that created the Puppet. While a Puppet this Equipment may be attacked as if it was an _Obstacle_. If _Damaged_, end this effect. When the effect ends, the _Equipment_ becomes unattended in the space it currently occupies.

name: Profile
effect: All Attacks have a Profile, a chart showing the results of an Attack on a roll of 2-12. When you make an Attack, roll 2d6 and consult the Profile for the result.

name: Reaction
effect: A _Maneuver_ that may be freely used when its Trigger occurs. Characters may use as many Reactions as they wish on a given _Turn_, but may only use a given Reaction once per _Turn_ unless otherwise specified.

name: Refresh
effect: Whenever a creature Refreshes they set their _Stamina_ to their maximum value, as defined by their Stances.

name: Reposition
effect: When you Reposition you may move the value listed for your Reposition Movement, as dictated by your Movement Chart.

name: Round
effect: A Round is a full cycle in combat, where all _Phases_ are completed. Many _Techniques_ and _Stances_ have effects that trigger at the end of a round.

name: Dash
effect: When you Dash you may move the value listed for your Dash Movement, as dictated by your Movement Chart.

name: Self
effect: This either only targets you or, if it has an Area, is centered on or originates from your space.

name: Shaper
effect: Shaper Disciplines heavily manipulate Terrain and Obstacles, either by creating them or removing them and can easily change the layout of the battlefield.

name: Secondary Sense
effect: Secondary Senses allow characters to perceive enemies in ways other than sight.  Secondary Sense allows a character to ignore_Stealthy_ under specific conditions. In addition, if a creature has Secondary Sense on a Target and the Attack is _Arcing_ they reduce any _Cover_ by an additional level.

name: Seismic Sense
effect: A creature with Seismic Sense ignores _Obscured_ for all creatures on _Earthen_ spaces and always treats themselves as having _Secondary Sense_ on creatures in those spaces.

name: Slash
effect:
Damage caused by lacerations, such as those caused by an axe or cutting blade.
 
When removing _Vulnerable_, you may inflict an equivalent amount of _Bleeding_ instead of increasing Damage if you deal Slash Damage.
 
If a character is _Downed_ by Slash Damage, inflict the following _Wounds_ based on the roll:
 1-2: _Bleeding_ 1
 3-4: _Bleeding_ 2
5-6: _Bleeding_ 3

name: Speed
effect: What _Phase_ a _Technique_ resolves in. This will be  a value from 1-8 or Weapon, which indicates that it uses of the Speed of the Weapon involved.

name: Speed Penalty
effect: When making an _Attack_ it takes a _Penalty_ equal to the difference between its _Speed_ and the current _Phase_ if the _Speed_ is greater than the _Phase_. For example, a _Speed_ 4 _Attack_ used in _Phase_ 2 would take a -2 _Penalty_. _Heavy_ _Attacks_ suffer double the usual _Penalty_.

name: Spirit Master
effect: The player in charge of running the game. While they do not have a predefined character, they control the world and all characters not under a different player's control.

name: Summon
effect: When a spirit is Summoned they take physical form for the duration of the effect that Summoned them. The spirit is placed on the map and participates in the battle as an additional combatant. They are fully under the control of their player. See their statistics for attacks, movement, and other such effects. By default, a spirit has no AP and may not use Techniques; the ability that Summoned them will grant those, if applicable. A spirit remains Summoned until the end of the Round. Alternatively, the summoner may end the Summon as a 1 _Momentum_ _Reaction_ triggered at the end of any _Phase_.

name: Stab
effect:
Damage that represents piercing wounds, such as those caused by an arrow or a knife.
 
When removing _Vulnerable_, you may inflict an equivalent amount of _Impaired_ instead of increasing Damage if you deal Stab Damage.
 
If a character is _Downed_ by Stab Damage, inflict the following _Wounds_ based on the roll:
 1-2: _Bleeding_ 1
 3-4: _Bleeding_ 1, _Impaired_ 1
5-6: _Bleeding_ 1, _Impaired_ 2

name: Stance
effect: A creature's Stance represents their bearing and how they are passively using their spirit's powers to improve their capabilities.

name: Stunt
effect: Stunts are quick, simple abilities such as jumping or picking up an item that characters may use on their _Turn_. Characters may use as many Stunts as they wish on their _Turn_, but may only use a given Stunt once per _Turn_ unless it has the _Repeatable_ keyword.

name: Standard
effect: Standard is the most common class of NPC. Standard enemies may never have more than 6 of a given _Token_ but may use a Martial and Spirit Stance.

name: Step
effect: When you Step you may move the value listed for your Step Movement, as dictated by your Movement Chart.

name: Strike
effect: A _Technique_ that tends to deal high-damage. Strikes are designated by a red line separating the header and body of the _Technique_.

name: Striker
effect: Striker Disciplines specialize in close-range combat, and often prioritize melee attacks over all else. Striker Disciplines are typically capable of the greatest damage in the system.

name: Supporter
effect: Supporter Disciplines are often able to provide allies with _Stamina_ or Momentum, as well as repositioning them, removing harmful effects, or otherwise assisting allies.

name: Survivor
effect: Survivor Disciplines tend to provide powerful Resists that allow characters to mitigate damage and other effects to remain in the battle longer.

name: Swim
effect: While moving through water that a character cannot stand in each space costs twice as much to enter. In addition, while Swimming, a creature has _Heavy Cover_, has _Disadvantage_ on all Attacks, and creatures have _Advantage_ on Attacks against them. Any _Jump_ a character makes while Swimming treats their _Jump_ value as halved.

name: Technique
effect: Techniques are how creatures interact in combat. These are what allow creatures to attack, influence the environment, and gain the resources to dodge and block attacks. A Technique must be selected while _Plotting_, at which point it is assigned a _Phase_. A creature may not use that Technique until that _Phase_.

name: Turn
effect: An individual creature's time to act in combat. Typically, a Turn involves a creature using a _Technique_.

name: Unarmed
effect: A special category of _Weapon_ that is an attack made using the character's body. Unarmed Weapons may not be _Disarmed_, and are always treated as _Wielded_.

name: Wager
effect: When a Wager occurs, all involved creatures must secretly pay an amount of whatever _Token_ is specified. Once all creatures have determined their Wager, how much each creature paid is revealed. Whatever creature paid the most wins the Wager, and all other creatures lose. In the case of a tie, the creature initiating the Wager wins.

name: Wielded
effect: A Wielded item is held in one or both hands. Many Actions requires that a character be wielding a specific type of item to make use of them. Wielded items are always also _Equipped_.

name: Winded
effect: A character becomes Winded when they have no _Health_. While Winded, a character adds [_Glancing_] to all effects. If a character gains _Health_ they are no longer Winded.
